title: Adults Hold the Line on Keeping Their Parents’ Phone Plans
sub_head: It might seem easy to joke about people in their 30s and 40s still being on their family’s plans. But those facing surging prices for everything from cars to cantaloupe say that bundled phone lines make good financial sense.
body:
Some adults are keeping their phone lines tethered to their parents as a way of cutting costs in the midst of surging inflation.
An October survey of 2,050 adults by personal finance site MagnifyMoney found that the parents of 39% of voting-age Gen Zers (which the survey defined as ages 18 to 24) and 12% of millennials (ages 25 to 40) pay their phone bills. Others fund their portion of the bill but prefer to retain the group discount by staying bundled.
